item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, January 25, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Cs16.css – CSS library based on Counter Strike 1.6 UI (521 points | 106 comments)
2. Show HN: Trolling SMS spammers with Ollama (142 points | 42 comments)
3. File Explorer is merged to Helix editor (57 points | 8 comments)
4. You could have invented Fenwick trees (63 points | 14 comments)
5. Life lessons from the first half-century of my career (29 points | 4 comments)
6. Show HN: Using YOLO to Detect Office Chairs in 40M Hotel Photos (19 points | 8 comments)
7. Wild – A fast linker for Linux (289 points | 129 comments)
8. Show HN: Lightpanda, an open-source headless browser in Zig (144 points | 89 comments)
9. French police free kidnapped Ledger executive (115 points | 68 comments)
10. Show HN: Onit – open-source ChatGPT Desktop with local mode, Claude, Gemini (88 points | 32 comments)
11. Snowdrop OS – a homebrew operating system from scratch, in assembly language (205 points | 46 comments)
12. A phishing attack involving g.co, Google's URL shortener (245 points | 106 comments)
13. Caltrain's electric fleet more efficient than expected (200 points | 146 comments)
14. Her dad, the 10k records he left behind and a viral lesson in grief (66 points | 35 comments)
15. Show HN: I recovered one of my earliest ZX-Spectrum games from an audio cassette (24 points | 2 comments)
16. Subpixel Snake [video] (206 points | 43 comments)
17. The hidden complexity of scaling WebSockets (91 points | 25 comments)
18. New book-sorting algorithm almost reaches perfection (185 points | 40 comments)
19. Anatomy of a Formal Proof (92 points | 2 comments)
20. A very Chicago gamble (122 points | 61 comments)
21. Chatbox: Cross-platform desktop client for ChatGPT, Claude and other LLMs (35 points | 5 comments)
22. Deadly and Imminent; The Pentagon's Mad Dash for Silicon Valley's AI Weapons (5 points | discuss)
23. Android SMS Gateway Using MQTT (21 points | 3 comments)
24. How I Use Home Assistant in 2025 (179 points | 190 comments)
25. Ask HN: Why buy domains and 301 redirect them to me? (264 points | 88 comments)
26. A WebAssembly compiler that fits in a tweet (203 points | 23 comments)
27. Trying out Zed after more than a decade of Vim/Neovim (136 points | 90 comments)
28. Cytoskeleton-functionalized synthetic cells with life-like mechanical features (13 points | 1 comment)
29. Converge (YC S23) is hiring engineer #2 in NYC ( | hide)
30. Cloud Virtualization: Red Hat, AWS Firecracker, and Ubicloud internals (52 points | 9 comments)
